feat.value: ...'I will struggle with my thought to not touch her.'
Abba Abraham said to him,
'Behold, you have not killed the passion,
it is still alive but it is bound.
Again, if you are walking on the road,
and you see some stones and some pottery pieces and gold in their midst,
is there power in your heart to reckon this one like those?'
He said, 'No.
But I will struggle with my thought in order to not take it.
The old man said to him,
'Behold again, the passion is living but it is bound.'
Again, Abba Abraham said,
'Behold, you heard concerning two brothers
that one loves you and glorifies you,
while the other one hates you and slanders you.
If they come to you,
will you receive them with this thought as the same?'
He said, 'No.
But I will wrestle with my heart
to do that which is good with the one who hates me like with the one who loves me.'
Abba Abraham said to him,
'Thus, therefore, the passions are alive,
but they are bound by the holy ones.'
